instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering on
threads.message:
no water damage.
20v 0.5a without battery. 20v 2a with battery.
fan spin for 2-3 sec and stop
Main S5, S4 and S0 rails are present.
<SIGNAL>PPVCCCPU_S0G</SIGNAL> - 0.9 at the beginning go down to 0v and the fan stop and then go up again to 0.9v and stay stable.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> - 3.3v  at the beginning go down to 0v and the fan stop and then go up again to 3.3v and stay stable.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> -3.3v at the beginning go down to 0v and the fan stop and then go up again to 3.3v and stay stable.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering on
threads.message:
Did you try the board alone on the desk?
Check for USB activity.

Worth to try known good BIOS...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering on
threads.message:
So NO USB activity in fact.
The board turns/stays on, but doesn't boot.

Try known good BIOS.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering on
threads.message:
Reflash the SPI chip <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.
If you don't have Medusa programmer, remove the chip and use classic USB programmer.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not powering on
threads.message:
I hope you've cleaned ME region too.
However board should boot even with dirty ME, if BIOS works in other board.

Probably bad CPU there...
